thread.title: Johnny Manziel Pulled Over After Fight With Girlfriend, Admitted to Drinking
thread.title_full: Johnny Manziel Pulled Over After Fight With Girlfriend, Admitted to Drinking

author: Kelly Terez
title: Johnny Manziel Pulled Over After Fight With Girlfriend, Admitted to Drinking
text:
Share Article 
Katherine Frey/The Washington Post via Getty Images (CLEVELAND) -- Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel was pulled over earlier this week in Avon, Ohio during an argument with his girlfriend. 
According to a four-page report obtained by ABC News affiliate WEWS-TV , Manziel and his Texas Christian University girfriend, Colleen Elizabeth Crowley, admitted to alcohol use but they were not charged. 
"We were aware of the situation," said Browns General Manager Ray Farmer in a statement. "It is a matter that we take seriously and have expressed our concerns to Johnny directly. Those conversations will remain private and we will refrain from further comment at this time." 
The report revealed a witness had called police when she saw Manziel's white Nissan pass her at high speed using the shoulder of the road. 
Crowley also reportedly tried to exit the vehicle while they were driving and threw the football player's wallet out of the car window at one point. 
When police stopped the couple, the report said Crowley told police Manziel had pushed her head into a window, but police determined an abrasion on her arm was due to Manziel's attempt to keep her from exiting the vehicle while it was moving. 
The couple were not charged because according to the report, police believed the couple were not intoxicated to the point of being charged, and Crowley had told officers she was not interested in pressing charges. 
The report said both left the scene in Manziel's car. 
Copyright   Friday, October 16, 2015 at 7:06PM
